repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: The collection contains books illustrated by Marzollo and promotional puzzles and games based on the popular series I Spy written by several prominent authors including Walter Wick.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Jean Marzollo was born in Manchester, CT. She is the author and author-illustrator of over 100 books and a former teacher. Marzollo graduated from the University of Connecticut in 1964 and received an M.A. in Teaching from Harvard University. She taught high school in Arlington, MA, and for Harvard's Upward Bound program. For twenty years she was the editor of Scholastic's early childhood magazine Let's Find Out. She is best known for her I Spy series with Walter Wick, as well as the Shanna's First Readers series. She has also adapted and illustrated a number of stories from the Bible and Greek and Roman mythology.
Additional information about the author is available from her website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Jean Marzollo Papers contains promotional versions of a number of Marzollo's works, as well as puzzles and games inspired from the I Spy book series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by format.
Series II: Puzzles, Games and Toys ( undated, 1996-2001)

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to children's literature and associated artwork. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Jean Marzollo Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Jean Marzollo in 2006.
